what: Step 2: Fit the Phylogeny to the CNA Data
title: Using bridges
text: run inference simulated data, disabling jitter smoothing.
code: k_jitter_fix <- 0  res <- bridges::fit(   data = sim$cna_data,   alleles = alleles_to_use,   k_jitter_fix = k_jitter_fix ) #> Pre-processing input... #> Computing G matrices using G_with_steps ... #> Computing B matrices using A_contig ... #> Computing final D matrix... #> Building tree... #> Reconstruct events...

what: Step 3: Compare Inferred and True Trees
title: Using bridges
text: compare inferred tree true simulated one using Robinson-Foulds distance.
code: true_tree <- sim$tree inferred_tree <- res$tree  phangorn::RF.dist(true_tree, inferred_tree, normalize = TRUE) #> [1] 0.136

what: Step 4: Visualize CN Profiles with Trees
title: Using bridges
text: can visualize true inferred trees alongside allele-specific CN profiles.
code: bridges::plot_heatmap(   sim$cna_data,   tree = sim$tree,   use_raster = FALSE,   ladderize = TRUE,   to_plot = c("CN", "A", "B"),   branch_length = 1 ) #> Scale for y is already present. #> Adding another scale for y, which will replace the existing scale. #> Processing feature: CN #>  #> Processing feature: A #>  #> Processing feature: B bridges::plot_heatmap(   sim$cna_data,   tree = res$tree,   use_raster = FALSE,   ladderize = TRUE,   to_plot = c("CN", "A", "B"),   branch_length = 1 ) #> Scale for y is already present. #> Adding another scale for y, which will replace the existing scale. #> Processing feature: CN #>  #> Processing feature: A #>  #> Processing feature: B

title: Using bridges
text: use built-BFB detection function quantify “BFB-ness” per chromosome allele.
code: bfb_detection_df <- bridges::detect_bfb(res) head(bfb_detection_df) #> # A tibble: 6 × 7 #>    mean N_trials N_successes chr   allele p.value threshold #>   <dbl>    <int>       <int> <chr> <chr>    <dbl>     <dbl> #> 1     0      127           0 1     A            1     0.005 #> 2     0      127           0 2     A            1     0.005 #> 3     0      127           0 3     A            1     0.005 #> 4     0      127           0 4     A            1     0.005 #> 5     0      127           0 5     A            1     0.005 #> 6     0      127           0 6     A            1     0.005  bfb_detection_df %>%   dplyr::mutate(chr = factor(chr, levels = c(1:22, "X", "Y"))) %>%   ggplot(aes(x = chr, y = mean, fill = allele)) +   geom_col(position = "dodge") +   theme_bw() +   lims(y = c(0, 1)) +   labs(x = "Chromosome", y = "BFB-ness", fill = "Allele")

title: Gillespie Simulation for Break-Fusion-Bridge (BFB) Processes Modified to support diploid chromosomes (alleles A and B) — bridge_sim
text: Simulates evolution cells undergoing Break-Fusion-Bridge cycles using continuous-time Gillespie algorithm. function models cell birth death processes possibility BFB events occurring replication. Cells amplified hotspots increased birth rate. Now supports modeling alleles (B) chromosome.

title: Gillespie Simulation for Break-Fusion-Bridge (BFB) Processes Modified to support diploid chromosomes (alleles A and B) — bridge_sim
code: bridge_sim(   initial_cells = 1,   chromosomes = c(1:22, "X", "Y"),   bin_length = 1e+06,   birth_rate = 0.1,   death_rate = 0.001,   bfb_allele = "1:A",   normal_dup_rate = 0,   bfb_prob = 0.5,   amp_rate = 1,   del_rate = 1,   wgd_available = 0,   wgd_probability = 0.05,   lambda = 2,   rate = 20,   positive_selection_rate = 0,   negative_selection_rate = 0,   max_time = 300,   max_cells = 256,   first_round_of_bfb = TRUE,   breakpoint_support = "uniform",   hotspot = list(chr = "1:A", pos = 100),   alpha = NULL,   beta = NULL,   custom_breakpoints = NULL )

title: Gillespie Simulation for Break-Fusion-Bridge (BFB) Processes Modified to support diploid chromosomes (alleles A and B) — bridge_sim
text: initial_cells Numeric. Number cells start simulation. Default: 1 chromosomes Character vector. Chromosomes model (e.g., c("1", "2", "X")). Default: c(1:22, "X", "Y") bin_length Numeric. Length genomic bin base pairs. Default: 5e5 birth_rate Numeric. Base rate cells replicate per unit time. Default: 0.1 death_rate Numeric. Rate cells die per unit time. Default: 0.001 bfb_allele Character. Allele affected BFB events. Defaul : "1:" normal_dup_rate Numeric. Rate normal duplication events. Default: 0.5 bfb_prob Numeric. Probability BFB event occurring replication. Default: 0.01 amp_rate Numeric. Rate amplification events. Default: 0.1 del_rate Numeric. Rate deletion events. Default: 0.1 wgd_available Numeric. Number whole-genome duplication events available. Default: 0 wgd_probability Numeric. Probability whole-genome duplication event occurring. Default: 0.05 lambda Rate parameter Poisson distribution used sample number genomic events per daughter cell rate Rate parameter used amplification/deletion simulations. Length event sample exponential distribution parameter 1 / rate. positive_selection_rate Numeric. Selection advantage cells amplified hotspot. Default: 0 negative_selection_rate Numeric. Selection disadvantage cells without amplified hotspot. Default: 0 max_time Numeric. Maximum simulation time. Default: 50 max_cells Numeric. Maximum number cells allowed simulation stops. Default: 100 first_round_of_bfb Logical. Whether apply BFB initial cells. Default: TRUE breakpoint_support Character. Distribution used breakpoint selection ("uniform", "beta", etc.). Default: "uniform" hotspot Named list. Hotspot positions chromosome allele (e.g., list(chr = "1:", pos = 100), default) alpha Numeric. First parameter beta distribution used breakpoint selection. Default: NULL beta Numeric. Second parameter beta distribution used breakpoint selection. Default: NULL

title: Create comprehensive heatmap with optional phylogenetic tree — plot_heatmap
text: data Data frame containing cell_id, chr, start, feature columns. Must include columns specified to_plot parameter. tree Phylogenetic tree object (optional). compatible ape phylo class objects. chromosomes_to_plot Vector chromosomes include plot. Default: c(1:22, "X", "Y") human chromosomes. to_plot Vector feature names plot. Default: "CN" (copy number). Must correspond column names data. tree_width Width tree display centimeters. Default: 3.5. show_tree Logical indicating whether display phylogenetic tree. Default: TRUE. branch_length Numeric value uniform branch length transformation tree. NULL (default), original branch lengths preserved. annotations Data frame cell_id column additional annotation columns. non-cell_id column becomes row annotation heatmap. Optional parameter. ladderize Logical indicating whether ladderize (sort) tree branches. Default: FALSE. reorder_tree Logical indicating whether optimize tree tip ordering better visualization. Default: TRUE. distance_matrix Distance matrix tree reordering optimization. Optional parameter used reorder_tree TRUE. use_raster Logical indicating whether use raster graphics heatmap. Default: TRUE better performance large datasets. raster_quality Numeric value controlling raster image quality. Higher values produce better quality. Default: 10. reconstruction Reconstruction data coloring tree branches based ancestral state reconstruction. Optional parameter. chr_for_coloring Chromosome identifier used tree branch coloring reconstruction data provided. Optional parameter. allele_for_coloring Specific allele used tree branch coloring reconstruction data provided. Optional parameter. tree_colors Vector colors tree branch coloring. Default: c("black", "goldenrod"). First color one state, second another. node_size Size internal nodes tree. Default: 1. tip_size Size tip nodes tree visualization. Default: 0 (tips displayed).
